message.content:
cs.GT, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.SOC, cs.DS 

This paper deals with mechanism design, which is a subfield of game theory (cs.GT). The setting involves participants being connected in a network, which suggests the subfield of social and information networks (cs.SI) may also be relevant. The paper also discusses the efficiency of resource allocation, which could fall under the subfield of network economics (cs.NI). Additionally, the paper considers the incentives of participants, which is a key aspect of social choice theory (cs.SOC). Finally, the paper proposes a novel mechanism, which may involve algorithmic design and optimization (cs.DS).
